bibl.title: Letter from John W. Kerr to Henry Rose Carter, August 27, 1917

div1.p: Kerr writes that LePrince will not be able to assist with mosquito control at Quantico, Virginia, because he is working elsewhere.

div1.head: Letter from John W. Kerr to Henry Rose Carter, August 27, 1917
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
AEB
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
August 27, 1917.
Assistant Surgeon-General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Custom House,
Norfolk, Virginia.
Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to your letter of the 24th instant, which
was made official, requesting to know whether the services
of Sanitary Engineer Le Prince could be made available for
consultation at Newport News and Quantico before September
15th, you are informed that this can be done on your recom-
mendation.

In a letter of August 25th, you are requested to
state whether you could handle the problems at Quantico with
the aid of Sanitary Engineer Crohurst. In case this is not
possible a statement from you to that effect should be sup-
plemented by the recommendation mentioned to the effect that
Mr. Le Prince should come to Virginia for conference.

While the Bureau is not informed as to how soon
the work Mr. Le Prince is engaged or can be terminated, it
is thought the conference at Quantico should be deferred as
long as possible as he has been actively engaged in organiz-
-2-
ing anti-malarial work in a number of extra cantonment areas
and will wish to advance this work as far as possible before
coming to Virginia.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, J. W Kerr
Assistant Surgeon-General.
